text: Astrid Mio Maria HasselborgAstrid Mio Maria Hasselborg (Sollefteå, 38 år) - Merinfo.se (born December 19, 1980) is a Swedish female curler.Landslagsspelare genom tiderna – Damer - Svenska Curlingförbundet (Swedish female national curlers; look at "Hasselborg, Maria") She is a two- time . Hasselborg was born in a family of well-known Swedish curlers; her father Stefan, uncle (Stefan's brother) Mikael, and cousins (Mikael's children) Marcus (son) and Anna (daughter). ==Teams== {| class="wikitable" |- ! scope="col"| Season ! scope="col"| Skip ! scope="col"| Third ! scope="col"| Second ! scope="col"| Lead ! scope="col"| Alternate ! scope="col"| Coach ! scope="col"| Events |- ! scope="row"| 2001–02 | Anette Norberg || Cathrine Norberg || Eva Lund || Maria Hasselborg || Anna Rindeskog || Stefan Lund || |- ! scope="row"| 2002 | Anette Norberg || Cathrine Norberg || Eva Lund || Helena Lingham || Maria Hasselborg || Stefan Lund || |- ! scope="row"| 2002–03 | Anna Bergström || Ulrika Bergman || Maria "Mia" Zackrisson || Mio Hasselborg || || || |- ! scope="row"| 2005–06 | Camilla Johansson || Katarina Nyberg || Mio Hasselborg || Elisabeth Persson || Linda Ohlson || || SWCC 2006 |- ! scope="row"| 2006–07 | Camilla Johansson || Katarina Nyberg || Mio Hasselborg || Elisabeth Persson || Linda Ohlsson || Per Noreen || (6th) |} ==References== ==External links== * * Category:Living people Category:1980 births Category:Swedish female curlers Category:European curling champions Category:Swedish curling champions
